abstract: From Bits: The online photo editing service Picnik announced Monday that it had been acquired by Google.
snippet: From Bits: The online photo editing service Picnik announced Monday that it had been acquired by Google.

headline.main: Google Buys Picnik, a Photo-Editing Service

abstract: In Tuesday’s tech news roundup: The Pirate Bay is still thriving despite legal efforts to shut it down, data is flowing through new channels on the Internet and Google patents location-based advertising.
snippet: In Tuesday’s tech news roundup: The Pirate Bay is still thriving despite legal efforts to shut it down, data is flowing through new channels on the Internet and Google patents location-based advertising.
lead_paragraph: Good morning, Bits readers. It’s Tuesday, and although the weather in New York is mostly cloudy, our technology news is not:

headline.main: Bits Scan: Pirate Bay, the Internet River and a Google Patent

abstract: Apple filed a lawsuit against HTC, maker of the Google-designed Nexus One, asserting that it infringed on patents related to the iPhone.
snippet: Apple filed a lawsuit against HTC, maker of the Google-designed Nexus One, asserting that it infringed on patents related to the iPhone.
lead_paragraph: 11:16 a.m. | Updated  Added response from HTC and a link to the legal documents.

headline.main: Apple Sues Phone Maker HTC Over Patents

abstract: Our daily roundup of nuggets from around the Web includes a look at an aesthetic movement called steampunk, a cultural history of 3-D movies and Topeka’s decision to rename itself Google, Kansas.
snippet: Our daily roundup of nuggets from around the Web includes a look at an aesthetic movement called steampunk, a cultural history of 3-D movies and Topeka’s decision to rename itself Google, Kansas.
lead_paragraph: Tuesday’s roundup of interesting tidbits from around the Web, selected by the technology reporters and editors of The New York Times:

headline.main: What We’re Reading: Steampunk, Roger Ebert and a City Called Google

abstract: In the lawsuit, Apple said HTC phones running Android violate 20 of its patents, including those relating to the iPhone’s ability to recognize the touch of multiple fingers on its screen at once.
snippet: In the lawsuit, Apple said HTC phones running Android violate 20 of its patents, including those relating to the iPhone’s ability to recognize the touch of multiple fingers on its screen at once.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple has relied on slick applications, and even slicker advertisements, to promote the iPhone and maintain its advantage over rivals like Google in the battle to rule the next generation of smartphones.

headline.main: Apple Sues Nexus One Maker HTC
headline.print_headline: Apple Sues Nexus One Maker HTC
